name: Vegan Apple Cider Donuts
description: Wonderfully spiced, moist and fluffy, these Vegan Apple Cider Donuts are baked instead of fried and infused with warm fall flavors. A perfect Fall treat and easy enough to make any day of the week. Friends and family will love them!
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups whole wheat pastry flour (or white flour)
1/4 cup soy milk (or other non-dairy milk)
2 tablespoons melted vegan butter or coconut oil
4 tablespoons melted vegan butter or coconut oil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and spray a donut pan (or two if you have it) with non stick spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and spray a donut pan (or two if you have it) with non stick spray.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cinnamon.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cinnamon.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the apple cider, soy milk, applesauce and melted vegan butter or coconut oil. Mix well with a large spoon to combine, but do not over mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the apple cider, soy milk, applesauce and melted vegan butter or coconut oil. Mix well with a large spoon to combine, but do not over mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Spoon the batter into the donut pan, or use a piping bag with large tip to pipe it evenly into each donut cavity, filling about 3/4 of the way full.
recipeInstructions.name: Spoon the batter into the donut pan, or use a piping bag with large tip to pipe it evenly into each donut cavity, filling about 3/4 of the way full.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 8-10 minutes, until the edges are lightly golden brown and they spring back when lightly pressed.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 8-10 minutes, until the edges are lightly golden brown and they spring back when lightly pressed.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool in the pan for about 2 minutes, then invert onto a cooling rack. Continue with all of the remaining batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool in the pan for about 2 minutes, then invert onto a cooling rack. Continue with all of the remaining batter.

recipeInstructions.text: While they are baking, make the topping: Stir together the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl, then melt the vegan butter or coconut oil in a separate bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: While they are baking, make the topping: Stir together the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl, then melt the vegan butter or coconut oil in a separate bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush each donut with a little vegan butter or coconut oil on all sides, then dip into the sugar-cinnamon mixture to coat well. You could also just brush the top and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar instead of coating the entire donut.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush each donut with a little vegan butter or coconut oil on all sides, then dip into the sugar-cinnamon mixture to coat well. You could also just brush the top and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar instead of coating the entire donut.

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy! They are best served right away but can be kept in an airtight container for 2 days.
recipeInstructions.name: Enjoy! They are best served right away but can be kept in an airtight container for 2 days.
